title: Business & Finance
text:
Supply-chain disruptions are threatening to rob some companies of holiday sales, leaving them short on packaging and transportation at a critical time of year.

---

Airlines have begun planning for possible flight disruptions as U.S. regulators weigh competing proposals for protecting aircraft from a new 5G cellular service slated to go live early next year, industry officials said.

---

Bank of Montreal is in talks to buy BNP Paribas's U.S. unit, Bank of the West, with about 500 branches in the Midwest and West.

---

Equifax is preparing to add short-term installment-payment plans to credit reports, a move meant to give lenders a fuller picture of people's financial commitments.

---

"Spider-Man: No Way Home" opened to $253 million at the weekend box office, setting a pandemic-era record.

---

YouTube TV and Walt Disney reached a deal to restore access to Disney-owned channels including ESPN and FX for YouTube TV subscribers.
